creator: Filip.L_Ecluse@alcatel.be
text:
It is not possible to use the __property() and the __P() functions in the
WebServiceSampler GUI fields where the url should be specified.
This means it is impossible to parametrize a web-service URL, which makes
automated testing really difficult.
Whenever I use the above functions in the URL field one of these two things happen:
1) the old text comes back and the text containing the call to the functions
disappears
2) the web service sampler does NOT resolve the function calls and uses the
field content AS IS.

I would have sent you a patch for this bug, but I did not understand how your
code works.

creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
I'm not sure I understand the bug. Are you trying to make it so the URL for the
wsdl or for the service take a function?

Currently that is a limitation of the webservice sampler. It does not take any
functions and simply sets the value provided by the GUI. I can take a look at
this next week. This week i am busy. The webservice sampler calls getURL() to
get the URL for the request.

thanks for filing the enhancement.

Actually I tried to modify the web service URL, the WSDL location, or both by
using the __property() function, but none of these worked.

Thanks for processing the enhancement!
creator: Filip.L_Ecluse@alcatel.be
woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
This is now fixed. the problem was because the GUI used 1 input for the URL. In
my naive thinking, since the URL is taken from the WSDL, I just make it one text
field. Now it's divided into 3 input fields just like HttpSampler. Hopefully
this fixes it. please give it a try. if it still doesn't work with the
functions, please re-open the bug.

peter
